thread.title: Man steals from 7 of victim's bank cards in Winchester theft
thread.title_full: Man steals from 7 of victim's bank cards in Winchester theft | Meridian - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Man steals from 7 of victim's bank cards in Winchester theft
text:
Officers want to speak to this man in connection with the theft Credit: Hampshire Police Police have released image of a man they want to speak to after a woman's purse was stolen in a Winchester supermarket.
The man followed her to her car and, while she was putting her shopping in the back of the car, he opened the passenger door and stole her purse.
The man then used all seven of her bank cards to withdraw money from ATMs in Winchester town centre, stealing Â£6450.
At some time between 1pm and 1.30pm on Monday 23rd January the victim was paying for her shopping in Waitrose, Stockbridge Road, when she noticed a man who was stood very close to her.
He's described as being aged 40 to 50, with a shaved head, wearing a red and blue chequered shirt, a blue puffa coat, blue jeans and red trainers.
Last updated Mon 13 Feb 2017
